It belongs to the family Didissandraceae and is characterized by its unique morphological features, including its woody structure and distinctive leaf arrangements. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions. Its flowers are small and clustered, with a unique structure that aids in pollination by specific insect species.
